intro: Dictyanthus macvaughianus, commonly known as the MacVaugh's sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant produces small, showy flowers in shades of pink and white, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are linear and covered in fine hairs, adapted to the arid environments it inhabits. Dictyanthus macvaughianus is often found in sandy soils along coastal dunes and rocky habitats.
